title: Natvis not embedded in staticlib

labels.name: A-debuginfo
labels.description: Area: Debugging information in compiled programs (DWARF, PDB, etc.)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Rust embeds natvis information in PDBs by default. However, due to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/89986, this doesn't happen with staticlibs. This makes debugging code linked statically into a C++ project harder.

I created a mostly-minimal reproduction of the issue here: https://github.com/obsgolem/rust-staticlib-issue-repro

To reproduce, make sure you are on a Windows machine with VS installed. Then do roughly the following:
```
cd cmake_test
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
```
Once this is done, open the Visual Studio solution and build all in Debug. Set the startup project to test, then set a breakpoint in `lib.rs:5`. When you hit the breakpoint, note that the debugger doesn't recognize the layout of the `Vec`.

To demonstrate the expected behavior, remove the `staticlib` entry from `CMakeLists.txt:14` and change the `crate-type` in `Cargo.toml` to `cdylib`. Then, following a clean build, you will find the debugger will correctly pick up the natvis for `Vec`.
